|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing how to manage acute abdominal pain in pregnant women
|Description=Know how to guide the clinical examination and suggest appropriate paraclinical tests during management.
|Rubric=Multimedia content

[[File:Douleurs abdominales de la femme enceinte.jpg|vignette|'''Douleurs abdominales de la femme enceinte'']]

question.title: What is the primary concern during the clinical examination of a pregnant woman with acute abdominal pain?
question.description: A pregnant woman presents with acute abdominal pain. What should be the primary concern during the clinical examination?

option_a.title: Uterine tenderness
option_a.description: The patient reports a dull ache in the lower abdomen, and the uterus is tender to palpation.

option_b.title: Adnexal tenderness
option_b.description: The patient reports a sharp pain in the lower abdomen, and the adnexal area is tender to palpation.

option_c.title: Rectal examination
option_c.description: The patient is uncomfortable with a rectal examination due to the presence of the fetus.

option_d.title: Pelvic examination
option_d.description: The patient is hesitant to undergo a pelvic examination due to concerns about the fetus.
